image.altText: Four people on surf boards bobbing in the ocean, beneath a pale blue sky with clouds

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: No real surprises here - Sweden remain unchanged from the team that were so brilliant in attack against Japan for 60 minutes - and then looked very ragged in defence for the final 30. Will fatigue play a role?
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: How Sweden line up: No changes from quarterfinal win

children.content: No real surprises here - Sweden remain unchanged from the team that were so brilliant in attack against Japan for 60 minutes - and then looked very ragged in defence for the final 30.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Big news for Spain is that Alexia Putellas starts for Spain. The two-time Balon d'Or winner started against Zambia but has been a sub mostly - and has not managed more than an hour in any game this tournament. She is one of two changes as Olga Carmona comes into the leftback role - and will step up as captain of the side due to Oihane HernÃ¡ndez 's suspension - and Esther GonzÃ¡lez drops out.
